parts.text: {"word":"evacuar","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"避難させる、退避させる","english_definition":"to remove people from a place of danger to a safer place.","spanish_definition":"Sacar personas o cosas de un lugar peligroso.","examples":[{"sentence":"Las autoridades decidieron evacuar la ciudad debido al huracán.","translation":"The authorities decided to evacuate the city due to the hurricane.","spanish_sentence":"Las autoridades decidieron evacuar la ciudad debido al huracán."},{"sentence":"Tuvimos que evacuar el edificio por una amenaza de bomba.","translation":"We had to evacuate the building due to a bomb threat.","spanish_sentence":"Tuvimos que evacuar el edificio por una amenaza de bomba."},{"sentence":"El pueblo fue evacuado antes de que llegara el volcán.","translation":"The town was evacuated before the volcano arrived.","spanish_sentence":"El pueblo fue evacuado antes de que llegara el volcán."}],"collocations":["evacuar una ciudad (evacuate a city)","evacuar un edificio (evacuate a building)","evacuar a los heridos (evacuate the injured)","orden de evacuar (evacuation order)"],"synonyms":["desalojar","desocupar","retirar","transferir"],"antonyms":["ocupar","invadir","permanecer"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"排出する、空にする","english_definition":"to empty something out; to discharge or remove contents.","spanish_definition":"Desocupar o vaciar algo; descargar o sacar el contenido.","examples":[{"sentence":"El médico le recomendó evacuar el intestino.","translation":"The doctor recommended emptying the bowel.","spanish_sentence":"El médico le recomendó evacuar el intestino."},{"sentence":"Es necesario evacuar el agua de la piscina antes de limpiarla.","translation":"It is necessary to drain the water from the pool before cleaning it.","spanish_sentence":"Es necesario evacuar el agua de la piscina antes de limpiarla."},{"sentence":"El camión evacuó los escombros del sitio de construcción.","translation":"The truck removed the debris from the construction site.","spanish_sentence":"El camión evacuó los escombros del sitio de construcción."}],"collocations":["evacuar el intestino (empty the bowel)","evacuar agua (drain water)","evacuar escombros (remove debris)","evacuar un líquido (drain a liquid)"],"synonyms":["vaciar","desaguar","drenar","descargar"],"antonyms":["llenar","acumular","retener"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","intransitive","definition":"排便する","english_definition":"to defecate; to have a bowel movement.","spanish_definition":"Expulsar las heces.","examples":[{"sentence":"El bebé no ha evacuado en dos días.","translation":"The baby hasn't had a bowel movement in two days.","spanish_sentence":"El bebé no ha evacuado en dos días."},{"sentence":"Si no evacuas regularmente, puedes tener problemas de salud.","translation":"If you don't have bowel movements regularly, you can have health problems.","spanish_sentence":"Si no evacuas regularmente, puedes tener problemas de salud."}],"collocations":["evacuar normalmente (have a normal bowel movement)","tener dificultad para evacuar (have difficulty having a bowel movement)"],"synonyms":["defecar","obrar","cagar (vulgar)"],"antonyms":["estreñirse"]}],"etymology":{"value":"From Latin 'evacuare', meaning 'to empty out'.","spanish_value":"Del latín 'evacuare', que significa 'vaciar'."},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ebaˈkwaɾ/","syllables":"e-va-cu-ar"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["evacuo","evacuas","evacua","evacuamos","evacuáis","evacuan"],"past_simple":["evacué","evacuaste","evacuó","evacuamos","evacuasteis","evacuaron"],"future_simple":["evacuaré","evacuarás","evacuará","evacuaremos","evacuaréis","evacuarán"],"present_participle":"evacuando","past_participle":"evacuado"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Evacuar' has different meanings depending on the context. It can refer to removing people from danger, emptying something out, or having a bowel movement. Pay attention to the context to understand the intended meaning.","spanish_explanation":"'Evacuar' tiene diferentes significados según el contexto. Puede referirse a sacar personas de un peligro, vaciar algo o tener una deposición. Presta atención al contexto para entender el significado deseado."},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"Evacué la casa con mi familia.","correct":"Evacué a mi familia de la casa.","note":"When referring to evacuating people, use 'evacuar a' + person + 'de' + place.","spanish_note":"Cuando se refiere a evacuar personas, usa 'evacuar a' + persona + 'de' + lugar."},{"incorrect":"Necesito evacuar mi estómago.","correct":"Necesito evacuar.","note":"When referring to defecating, you can simply say 'evacuar' without specifying what is being evacuated.","spanish_note":"Cuando se refiere a defecar, puedes simplemente decir 'evacuar' sin especificar qué se está evacuando."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["evacuación (evacuation)","evacuado (evacuated person)"],"related_verbs":["desalojar (to evict)","desocupar (to vacate)","drenar (to drain)"],"related_nouns":["refugio (shelter)","emergencia (emergency)","desastre (disaster)"]},"level_frequency":{"level":"B2","frequency_corpus":"Common","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"The word 'evacuar' is used in situations involving safety, health, and construction. It's important to understand the context to know if it means removing people from danger, emptying something, or a bodily function.","spanish_text":"La palabra 'evacuar' se usa en situaciones relacionadas con la seguridad, la salud y la construcción. Es importante entender el contexto para saber si significa sacar personas de un peligro, vaciar algo o una función corporal."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"El gobierno ordenó evacuar la zona costera debido a la tormenta.","translation":"The government ordered the evacuation of the coastal area due to the storm.","type":"transitive verb","meaning_category":"remove people from danger"},{"sentence":"Es importante evacuar el agua estancada para prevenir la propagación de mosquitos.","translation":"It is important to drain standing water to prevent the spread of mosquitoes.","type":"transitive verb","meaning_category":"empty something out"},{"sentence":"El médico le preguntó al paciente si había podido evacuar normalmente.","translation":"The doctor asked the patient if he had been able to have a normal bowel movement.","type":"intransitive verb","meaning_category":"defecate"}]}
